programme.title: Silent Night: A Song For the World
programme.desc: A musical film documentary about the cultural impact of the world's most famous Christmas carol. Composed in 1818 in Salzburg, and translated into 140 languages, Silent Night caused a Christmas ceasefire in World War I, while Bing Crosby's version is the third best-selling single ever. In short: A song for the world! The film tells the story of Silent Night, narrated by Hugh Bonneville, with new recordings by global stars in different languages.

programme.title: The 700 Club
programme.desc: A religious-themed newsmagazine, one of TV's longest-running programs. On the air since 1966, it launched nationally in '72, before becoming the flagship of the Christian Broadcast Network in 1977. It mixes news---from a religious perspective---with inspirational interviews with celebrities, along with Bible readings and entertainment. Conservative icon (and 1988 presidential candidate) Pat Robertson founded the hugely popular program from a 1963 fund-raising pledge effort on UHF TV in Virginia.

programme.title: Enchanted

She meets a divorced lawyer (Patrick Dempsey) who takes her in while she awaits the arrival of her Prince Charming (James Marsden). Narrated by Julie Andrews. Three of the film's tunes were nominated for the Best Song Oscar. Idina Menzel, Timothy Spall, Rachel Covey.

programme.title: Fantastic Four

Chris Evans, Michael Chiklis, Julian McMahon. Directed by Tim Story.

programme.title: Fantastic Four: Rise of the Silver Surfer
programme.desc: Mr. Fantastic, the Invisible Woman, the Human Torch and the Thing return in this exciting sequel to the 2005 sci-fi hit. This time, the four superheroes encounter a mysterious alien who heralds the arrival of the planet-devouring Galactus.

programme.title: The Avengers
programme.desc: In this marvelous superhero epic, Iron Man, Captain America, the Hulk and Thor are forced to overcome their differences and work together in order to save the world from Thor's brother Loki, who has obtained a mystical artifact of tremendous power.

programme.title: Emperor of the North
programme.desc: Lee Marvin and Ernest Borgnine play rough in this yarn about a hobo determined to ride a train watched over by a sadistic railroad guard. Cigaret: Keith Carradine. Cracker: Charles Tyner. Hogger: Malcolm Atterbury. Policeman: Simon Oakland. Gray Cat: Elisha Cook. Filmed in Oregon. Directed by Robert Aldrich.

programme.title: A Royal Scandal

programme.title: Désirée
programme.desc: Fictionalized account of Napoleon's romance with the woman who would become the queen of Sweden.

programme.title: The Last American Hero
programme.desc: Jeff Bridges and Valerie Perrine won praise in this story about stock-car racers and their followers. Geraldine Fitzgerald, Ned Beatty. Wayne: Gary Busey. Father: Art Lund. Colt: Ed Lauter. Morley: Gregory Walcott. Kyle: William Smith II. Directed by Lamont Johnson. Also called "Hard Driver."

programme.title: Green Book
programme.desc: Bouncer Tony Lip is hired by African-American musician Don Shirley to chauffer him around the Jim Crow South in 1962 for an eight-week concert tour. The mismatched men form a friendship as Tony learns first-hand the racism Don must endure to perform.

programme.title: The Greatest Showman
programme.desc: This wondrous musical about the life of entrepreneur P.T. Barnum depicts how he found fame and fortune by starting a circus in 1870s America, and posits that he was the creator of modern show business.

programme.desc: A chronicle of the rock band Queen, who rose to fame thanks to their revolutionary sound and the theatrics of their front man, the iconic Freddie Mercury, culminating in their reunion for the historic set they played at Live Aid in July 1985.

programme.desc: Santa grants a wish for a meek employee, giving her the courage to prove herself at work. However, the magic of this wish has a time limit, forcing the woman to find a way to maintain her newfound confidence.

programme.title: The Sweetest Christmas
programme.desc: A pastry chef makes it to the finals of gingerbread contest, and she gets help from her old beau from high school, who lets her use his restaurant to prepare for the competition. As they grow closer, she realizes she must embrace the Christmas spirit.

programme.title: An Unexpected Christmas
programme.desc: A writer convinces his ex-girlfriend to pose as a couple for Christmas.

programme.title: Jolly Good Christmas
programme.desc: When by-the-book architect David hires free-spirited personal shopper Anji, he finds himself on a wild ride across London in search of the perfect Christmas gift but finds something he wasn't looking for.

programme.title: Inventing the Christmas Prince
programme.desc: Shelby is ready to resign from her job as a rocket engineer. However, her daughter is certain that her Scrooge-esq manager Evan is the Christmas Prince from a story Shelby wrote long ago.

programme.title: My Southern Family Christmas
programme.desc: Journalist Campbell encounters her estranged father and his new family while in Louisiana writing a feature on the Pere Noel Christmas celebration.

programme.title: #Xmas
programme.desc: Interior designer Jen aims to win a social media contest for a design brand by posing as an influencer with her best friend playing her husband and her nephew as her baby. When she is selected as a finalist, Jen is torn about whether to keep up the lie or reveal the truth.

programme.title: A Royal Corgi Christmas
programme.desc: Prince Edmond plans to win his mother over with the gift of a cute but out-of-control corgi. He turns to American dog trainer Cecily to help get the pup ready for the Christmas Ball.

programme.title: Crown for Christmas
programme.desc: A fired New York City maid reluctantly becomes a governess to a poorly behaved little girl who turns out to be European royalty. Before long, the two form a strong bond, and the governess also grows close to the young princess's engaged father.

programme.title: We Wish You a Married Christmas
programme.desc: A couple goes to a quiet town to reconnect at Christmas on the advice of their marriage coach.

programme.title: A Nashville Christmas Carol
programme.desc: A television producer is forced to work with the man who broke her heart on a country music Christmas special while being interrupted by Christmas spirits determined for her to revisit her past.

programme.title: Pride, Prejudice, and Mistletoe
programme.desc: Darcy has always worked hard to prove herself. She returns home to plan a Christmas charity event with her old rival Luke. She realizes what is important in life by repairing her relationship with her father and finding love.

programme.title: 'Tis the Season to be Merry
programme.desc: Looking for a fresh angle to her book on relationships, Merry heads to snow covered Vermont. She finds a new perspective and Christmas cheer with charismatic aid worker Adam.

programme.title: Christmas at the Golden Dragon
programme.desc: A much-loved Chinese restaurant decides to close its doors at the start of the festive season. Two sisters and a bunch of regulars are forced to rexamine their lives in a series of interwoven stories on the busiest week of the year.

programme.title: A Very Merry Bridesmaid

programme.desc: Three brothers find their holiday plans upended when they must work together to care for an infant.

programme.title: The Fast History Of
programme.desc: The history about the secret lives of the world's wealthiest and all the most shocking ways they spend their fortunes. Examining how much gold King Tut was buried with to enjoy in the afterlife; how Elon Musk, Richard Brandon and Jeff Bezos ended up in a Space Race that used to exist between the U.S., Russia and China.

programme.title: The Fast History Of
programme.desc: The incredible full story of Nike, from their early days selling Japanese sneakers from the trunk of a car. Their highs and lows, how air tech came to be, a look behind the brand's most iconic campaigns and how taking a crazy chance on a rookie turned Nike into the 33 Billion dollar empire they are today.

programme.title: The Fast History Of
programme.desc: The superstore-sized history of Walmart. Since its founding in 1962, Walmart has grown from a humble discount store in rural Arkansas to the largest company in the world. With over 11,000 locations, they employ more people than the U.S. Armed Forces. Walmart averages a profit of $1.8 million dollars, every hour.

programme.title: The Fast History Of
programme.desc: Jack Daniel's, the most popular whiskey in the world, has been making their unique blend since 1866. But the story of how a couple of backwoods bootleggers invented Tennessee whiskey is full of unexpected turns. Like the secrets behind their unique recipe, how they barely survived prohibition, the endorsement that created a national shortage and how Hollywood ran away with the brand's image.

programme.title: The Food That Built America

programme.title: The Food That Built America

programme.title: The Food That Built America
programme.desc: After a bakery owner's death, his wife takes the reigns and grows it into a national powerhouse. Meanwhile, a married couple have bankrupted one bakery, but are determined to succeed their second time around and conquer the baking world with a revolutionary way to sell snack cakes.

programme.title: The Food That Built America

programme.title: The Food That Built America

programme.title: 2 Broke Girls
programme.desc: Max and Caroline's attempt to break Nash into the modeling business is threatened when his mother arrives from Ireland to retrieve her son.

programme.title: 2 Broke Girls
programme.desc: Max and Caroline help launch the opening of The High's new location at JFK airport. Meanwhile, Sophie learns that Oleg may have an ulterior motive for wanting to marry her.

programme.title: 2 Broke Girls
programme.desc: Season 4 ends with Max and Caroline tasked with retrieving Sophie's wedding dress from airport customs and safely transporting it to the church in time for the nuptials.

programme.title: Charlie and the Chocolate Factory
programme.desc: Tim Burton ("Edward Scissorhands") directed this wonderfully whimsical fantasy. A poor boy (Freddie Highmore) and four bratty children win a tour of a mysterious chocolate factory. Their personal guide is the owner, an eccentric candy man (Johnny Depp) named Willy Wonka. The film is based on Roald Dahl's classic children's tale and is a remake of 1971's "Willy Wonka & the Chocolate Factory."

programme.title: Arthur Christmas
programme.desc: This delightful animated family comedy follows Santa's mischievous son Arthur (voice of James McAvoy) as he races against time to ensure that the children of the world receive their presents by Christmas morning.

programme.title: Fred Claus
programme.desc: Santa's ne'er-do-well older brother wreaks havoc on the holidays when he is forced to work at the North Pole's toy shop to pay off a debt. Vince Vaughn and Paul Giamatti star in this hilarious and heartwarming family comedy. John Michael Higgins, Miranda Richardson, Rachel Weisz, Kathy Bates. Directed by David Dobkin.

programme.title: Julius Caesar
programme.desc: "Friends, Romans, countrymen" and critics heaped praise and a Best Picture nomination on Shakespeare's historical drama of tyranny, deceit, political betrayal and assassination in ancient Rome. Marlon Brando was nominated for Best Actor as Marc Antony.

programme.title: The Life of the Party
programme.desc: Trifle about gold-digging shopgirls (Winnie Lightner, Irene Delroy) hunting hubbies in Havana. A.J.: Jack Whiting. Col. Joy: Charles Butterworth. Le Maire: Charles Judels. Mr. Smith: John Davidson. Directed by Roy Del Ruth.

programme.title: The Big Store
programme.desc: A PI is hired to protect a department-store heir from a sleazy manager, who tries to eliminate the inheritor apparent in order to keep his book-cooking a secret.

programme.title: The Shop Around the Corner
programme.desc: Two coworkers at a Budapest gift shop unknowingly correspond with each other, having "met" through a lonely-hearts ad, but as the pen pals grow closer on paper, their at-work bickering drives them further apart. Remade in 1949 as the musical "In the Good Old Summertime" and updated and reworked as "You've Got Mail" in 1998.

programme.title: Lovely to Look At
programme.desc: An American inherits a Parisian dress salon from his late aunt, and ventures to France with his two best friends on a mission to convince the other owners to sell their half in order to finance a Broadway show. When the three Americans discover that the salon is all but broke, they pool their resources and wits to make the establishment a winning proposition.

programme.title: Bachelor Mother
programme.desc: When a man mistakes a pretty, fun-loving department-store clerk for the mother of a foundling baby, he becomes determined to keep mom and child together, much to her dismay.

programme.title: In the Good Old Summertime
programme.desc: Two clerks in a turn-of-the-20th-century Chicago sheet-music store are intensely antagonistic toward each other, but unbeknownst to the two, they actually are getting very chummy as pen pals. A musical remake of "The Shop Around the Corner," in which the setting was changed from a Budapest sundries shop.

programme.title: The Women
programme.desc: An all-star, all-female cast is featured in an adaptation of the Clare Boothe Luce Broadway hit about a cabal of catty and chatty high-society women who chime in on the affairs of a loving wife and mother who's dealing with an adulterous husband.

programme.title: The Wonderful World of the Brothers Grimm
programme.desc: The famous Brothers Grimm and their origins as storytellers are explored, with the fairy tales they would become known for interwoven throughout their biographical narrative, as they are tasked with writing a chronicle for the local duke, but soon become distracted by more fanciful tales.

programme.title: How the West Was Won
programme.desc: Star-studded frontier epic chronicles a pioneer family's progress from 1830s Ohio to the Arizona Territory of the 1880s. The film covers five segments of their journey: "The Rivers," "The Plains," "The Civil War," "The Railroads" and "The Outlaws." James Webb won an Oscar for Best Original Screenplay.

programme.title: Scream Queen! My Nightmare On Elm Street
programme.desc: About the controversial sequel to A Nightmare on Elm Street, which ended Mark Patton's acting career, just as it was beginning. Now available On Demand the same day as DVD. Mark Patton, Robert Englund.

programme.title: A Nightmare on Elm Street 2: Freddy's Revenge
programme.desc: Freddy Krueger returns to haunt the dreams of a teenage boy who has moved into the house of the only survivor of Freddy's original reign of terror.

programme.title: A Warm December
programme.desc: An American doctor in London falls for an African ambassador's niece.

programme.title: The Field Mouse
programme.desc: It's about these children mice on a farm doing work for their mama and grandpop. The mom catches one of her offspring, Herman, sleeping late and wakes him up by spanking him. After he cries to Grandpa, the ground starts shaking. The tractor is on the way!

programme.title: Annie Was a Wonder
programme.desc: This Academy Award-nominated short subject relates the tale of Annie Swenson (Kathleen Freeman), a Scandinavian immigrant who came to the U.S. and found work as a cook-housekeeper. Narrated by John Nesbitt. Nesbitt: Howard Negley. Mrs. Nesbitt: Ruth Lee. Gus: Swen Hugo Borg.

programme.title: Hong Kong: 'The Hub of the Orient'
programme.desc: An MGM "Traveltalks" short about the history, people and customs of Hong Kong.

programme.title: Boots and Saddles
programme.desc: Gene Autry sings, fights and rides the range. Smiley Burnette, Judith Allen.

programme.title: The New Adventures of Tarzan: Secret Signals
programme.desc: The jungle warrior Tarzan searches for his missing friend, while helping an officer search for a hidden treasure which becomes dangerous in the wrong hands.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: A paroled ex-convict gets a job at a school for wayward boys and works to improve their conditions, including revealing the cruelty and corruption of the warden. The warden schemes to thwart the ex-con's plans by getting him sent back to prison.

programme.title: Sucker List
programme.desc: Entry in the "Crime Does Not Pay" series focuses on bogus racetrack touts who pass out phony tip sheets and prey on bettors who are deep in debt. Joe Yule, father of Mickey Rooney, has a small role as a man asking for a match.

programme.title: Annie
programme.desc: John Huston's adaptation of the Broadway musical about the plucky comic-strip orphan who dreams of finding a loving family while toiling in an institution run by a mean woman.

programme.title: The Adventures of Huckleberry Finn
programme.desc: Adaptation of the Mark Twain classic about a rascally lad and his adventures with a runaway slave on the Mississippi River in the 19th century.

programme.title: King Solomon's Mines
programme.desc: The wife of an adventurer hires an explorer to find her missing husband, who never came back from an expedition to find the legendary diamond mines of the Biblical ruler. A Best Picture nominee.

programme.title: Stagecoach
programme.desc: A group of people traveling through Indian country on a stagecoach are pressured by the threat posed by Geronimo and discover which among them can stay cool in a crisis.

programme.title: An Inconvenient Truth
programme.desc: This compelling and alarming documentary about the perils of global warming focuses on former vice president Al Gore's multimedia environmental lecture tour, which features persuasive scientific data, computerized charts, photos and archival footage. Directed by Davis Guggenheim.

programme.title: Boys Don't Cry
programme.desc: Hilary Swank won an Oscar for her stunning, nuanced and utterly believable portrayal of Teena Brandon, a Nebraska woman who assumes the identity of a man, Brandon Teena, when she moves to a new town. Best Supporting Actress nominee Chloe Sevigny is also outstanding as the sensitive woman who dates Brandon. Peter Sarsgaard, Brendan Sexton III, Alison Folland.

programme.title: Death of a Cyclist
programme.desc: Study in human relationships, involving a hit-and-run accident that has unexpected repercussions. Lucia Bose, Alberto Closas. Miguel: Otello Toso. Rafa: Carlos Casaravilla. Matilde: Bruna Corra.

programme.title: Hannah and Her Sisters
programme.desc: Woody Allen wrote, directed and stars in this relationship comedy about three Manhattan sisters and the men in their lives. One of the women suspects her husband of lusting after her youngest sister. Oscars went to Allen for his screenplay and to supporting actors Dianne Wiest and Michael Caine.

programme.title: Crossing Delancey
programme.desc: A woman tries to find the perfect man for her granddaughter, Isabelle, by hiring a matchmaker. Isabelle is underwhelmed at first when she's paired with a pickle vendor, but he is taken with her and goes to great lengths to win her affection.

programme.title: Grand Hotel
programme.desc: This Best Picture winner charts 24 hours in the lives of guests at a plush Berlin hostelry, where a down-on-his-luck thief covets a ballerina's pearls, while lusting after the mistress of a businessman whose dying bookkeeper is tended by a drunken doctor.

programme.title: Johnny Belinda
programme.desc: Jane Wyman won an Oscar for her portrayal of a deaf woman living a hardscrabble life in a Nova Scotia fishing village, where she is taught to communicate by a young doctor. Later, she is raped by a local lout, and charged when he is later found murdered. The film was nominated for 12 Oscars, including Best Picture, Director (Jean Negulesco) and Actor (Lew Ayres), but Wyman's was the only win.
